CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Seasoned Design and Construction Project Manager with more than 13 years' experience in managing multimillion
projects in the US and abroad. Expertise in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of design and construction, from
conceptualization to completion, while providing continuous status reports to business owners and investors. Proven
track record of achieving construction goals and consistently completing projects on time and budget. Fluency in
English and Italian with working knowledge of Spanish and French. Seeking to leverage success and experience to take
next career step in a challenging project management position with a respected institution in Connecticut.

SKILLS

Sage Timberline Software, Compeat, QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)

EXPERIENCE

Construction and Design Project Manager

10/2002 to Current
Company Name
City ,
State
Oversee all facets of project management for several multimillion-dollar restaurant and residential projects in
New York City and London, including contract negotiations and administration, project estimation, material
purchasing, budget management, and site management; managed design and construction for 10 projects to
date. Coordinate with owner and investors during pre-construction phase to develop requirements, scopes of work, and
budgets; execute and manage budget and schedules from conception to completion. Organize trades, procure source materials, and liaise between owner, principal architect, designers, engineers,
subcontractors, and vendors.
Partner with architects to solicit bids for construction and design, assess bids, and award contracts.
Manage selection and hiring of design and construction subcontractors, and work with both teams to achieve
milestones on time and on budget. Document observations and photograph ongoing design and construction work, produce field reports, and
regularly communicate project status to internal partners weekly. Investigate issues and expedite resolution to maintain timelines and budgets; develop strategies to prevent
recurrence of issues. Research and commission artisans to build site specific and custom objects for interior and exterior design and
d√©cor. Source and purchase materials from international vendors, and purchase and coordinate material shipments from
vendors to construction sites. Ensure compliance with requisite regulations, including federal, state, and local building codes and safety
guidelines.
Past experience includes Education Program Coordinator at Solomon R.
Guggenheim Museum, Office
Manager at Cranmer Art Conservation, Inc., and Assistant Program Manager at Trinity College.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Civil Estimator - 1883589

Location: New Rochelle, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About Us:

Infrastructure is the backbone of society, playing a vital role in ensuring safety, enhancing quality of life, and fostering economic growth. Our company has been at the forefront of building and renovating the nation's infrastructure for over a century, delivering projects that are essential to public service.

Our expertise encompasses constructing and upgrading roadways, bridges, tunnels, mass transit networks, and facilities for water and wastewater management. We're committed to making essential services more efficient and effective, backed by our unwavering commitment to ethical business practices, financial stability, and a track record of successful project delivery.

We're involved in significant projects nationwide, such as major transit system expansions, tunnel constructions for alleviating traffic, transformative rail system upgrades, and extensive airport and bridge enhancements. Working with us means being part of impactful projects like these, which contribute significantly to community development.

Key Responsibilities:

In this role, reporting to the Senior Estimation Manager, you will be tasked with:

 Crafting detailed cost projections for various civil infrastructure projects including bridges, highways, railways, airports, dams, and tunnels. Examining and fully comprehending project bids, blueprints, and technical documents. Independently conducting or overseeing detailed quantity assessments for various project types, compiling data using spreadsheet software. Creating detailed price estimates by determining workforce needs, equipment, and materials, utilizing advanced cost estimation software, with HCSS being the preferred tool.


Qualifications:

 A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field from an accredited college or university, with over 10 years of experience in estimation and project management. A minimum of 5 years of experience in cost estimation for large-scale civil engineering projects. Experience with projects valued at $100 million or above. Strong interpersonal skills for effective communication with project stakeholders, suppliers, and subcontractors, from the pre-bid phase to post-bid discussions. Ability to collaborate seamlessly with a team of estimators to deliver comprehensive cost proposals, especially for large-scale, joint venture projects. Experience with project delivery methods like design-build and CMAR is advantageous.


This position offers a salary range of $150,000 to $225,000, commensurate with experience.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
